intro: Begonia aequatoguineensis, commonly known as the Equatorial Guinea begonia, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from red to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal. Begonia aequatoguineensis prefers well-draining soil and consistent moisture for optimal growth.
